etymologies: mid 16th century: from Taino casávi, cazábbi, influenced by French cassave

definitions: the starchy tuberous root of a tropical tree, used as food in tropical countries but requiring careful preparation to remove traces of cyanide from the flesh.
shortDefinitions: starchy tuberous root of tropical tree

definitions: a starch or flour obtained from the cassava root.
shortDefinitions: starch or flour obtained from cassava

definitions: the shrubby tree from which cassava is obtained, native to tropical America and cultivated throughout the tropics.

notes.text: Genus Manihot, family Euphorbiaceae: several species, in particular bitter cassava (M. esculenta) and sweet cassava (M. dulcis)

shortDefinitions: shrubby tree from which cassava is obtained, native to tropical America
